  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 Better is the poor that walketh in her integrity than she that is perverse in her lips and a fool at the same time. 2 Also, that the soul be without knowledge is not good; and she that hasteth with her feet sinneth. 3 The foolishness of woman perverteth her way; and her heart fretteth against the Domina. 4 Wealth addeth many friends; but as for the poor, her friend separateth herself from her. 5 A false witness shall not be unpunished; and she that breatheth forth lies shall not escape. 6 Many will entreat the favour of the liberal woman; and every woman is a friend to her that giveth gifts. 7 All the sisters of the poor do hate her; how much more do her friends go far from her! She that pursueth words, they turn against her. 8 She that getteth wisdom loveth her own soul; she that keepeth understanding shall find good. 9 A false witness shall not be unpunished; and she that breatheth forth lies shall perish.

 10 Luxury is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princesss. 11 It is the discretion of a woman to be slow to anger, and it is her glory to pass over a transgression. 12 The queen's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but her favour is as dew upon the grass. 13 A foolish daughter is the calamity of her mother; and the contentions of a husband are a continual dropping. 14 House and riches are the inheritance of mothers; but a prudent husband is from the Domina.
15 Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and the idle soul shall suffer hunger. 16 She that keepeth the commandment keepeth her soul; but she that despiseth Her ways shall die. 17 She that is gracious unto the poor lendeth unto the Domina; and her good deed will She repay unto her. 18 Chasten thy daughter, for there is hope; but set not thy heart on her destruction. 19 A woman of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou interpose, thou wilt add thereto. 20 Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end. 21 There are many devices in a woman's heart; but the counsel of the Domina, that shall stand. 22 The lust of a woman is her shame; and a poor woman is better than a liar. 23 The fear of the Domina tendeth to life; and she that hath it shall abide satisfied, she shall not be visited with evil. 24 The sluggard burieth her hand in the dish, and will not so much as bring it back to her mouth. 25 When thou smitest a scorner, the simple will become prudent; and when one that hath understanding is reproved, she will understand knowledge. 26 A daughter that dealeth shamefully and reproachfully will despoil her mother, and chase away her father. 27 Cease, my daughter, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge. 28 An ungodly witness mocketh at right; and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
